api/ModMenu.Config.FieldAttribute.html.title: Class FieldAttribute | poy-mod-menu
api/ModMenu.Config.FieldAttribute.html.summary: Class FieldAttribute Namespace ModMenu.Config Assembly ModMenu.dll An attribute which allows you to customise how a field will be displayed. This also provides extra information which can be used for data validation. FieldAttributes can be applied to either "plain" types or BepInEx ConfigEntry types. A "plain" type is something like an int, float, double, etc. [AttributeUsage(AttributeTargets.Property|AttributeTargets.Field, AllowMultiple = true)] public class FieldAttribute : Attribute, string description = null) Parameters fieldType FieldType The field type to use description string The description to display in a tooltip FieldAttribute(string, FieldType) Initializes a field attribute with a specified name and field type. public FieldAttribute(string name, FieldType fieldType) Parameters name string The display name to use fieldType FieldType The field type to use FieldAttribute(string, string) Initializes a field attribute with a specified name and optional description. public FieldAttribute(string name, string description = null) Parameters name string The display name to use description string The description to display in a tooltip FieldAttribute(string, string, FieldType) Initializes a field attribute with a specified name, description, and field type. public FieldAttribute(string name, string description, FieldType fieldType) Parameters name string The display name to use description string The description to display in a tooltip fieldType FieldType The field type to use Properties description A brief description of this field. This will display in a tooltip. Unspecified (null) descriptions behave like so: ConfigEntry: The description configured in the ConfigEntry will be used Plain: The description will be left blank public virtual string description { get; set; } Property Value string fieldType The type of this field. This determines which UIComponent will be used. public virtual FieldType fieldType { get; set; } Property Value FieldType max The maximum value permitted. This field must be a numeric type for you to use this. public virtual object max { get; set; } Property Value object min The minimum value permitted. This field must be a numeric type for you to use this. public virtual object min { get; set; } Property Value object name The display name of this field. Unspecified (null) names behave like so: ConfigEntry: The name configured in the ConfigEntry will be used Plain: The name of the field will be used public virtual string name { get; set; } Property Value string

api/ModMenu.Config.FieldType.html.title: Enum FieldType | poy-mod-menu
api/ModMenu.Config.FieldType.html.summary: Enum FieldType Namespace ModMenu.Config Assembly ModMenu.dll The types of fields which Mod Menu can display. public enum FieldType Fields Color = 2 Displays a ColorField. KeyCode = 3 Displays a KeyCodeField. None = 0 The default field type, lets Mod Menu infer the most likely type. ReadOnly = 6 Displays the field's value as a Label. Slider = 4 Displays a Slider. Text = 5 Displays a TextField. Toggle = 1 Displays a Toggle component.

api/ModMenu.Config.ListenerAttribute.htm.title: Class ListenerAttribute | poy-mod-menu
api/ModMenu.Config.ListenerAttribute.htm.summary: Class ListenerAttribute Namespace ModMenu.Config Assembly ModMenu.dll An attribute which provides a way of knowing when Mod Menu has changed a field's value. Listeners must be static methods. For listener attributes applied to fields: They must take a single value, which must match the type of the field If you use a ConfigEntry<T>, Mod Menu will unwrap this type and use the inner T instead. For listener attributes applied to classes: They must take two values, which are a MemberInfo and an object (in this order). The first argument is the MemberInfo of the field/property which was updated The second argument is the value it was set to [AttributeUsage(AttributeTargets.Class|AttributeTargets.Property|AttributeTargets.Field, AllowMultiple = true)] public class ListenerAttribute : Attribute, _Attribute Inheritance object Attribute api/ModMenu.Config.PredicateAttribute.ht.title: Class PredicateAttribute | poy-mod-menu
api/ModMenu.Config.PredicateAttribute.ht.summary: Class PredicateAttribute Namespace ModMenu.Config Assembly ModMenu.dll An attribute which allows you to check a user input before Mod Menu updates a field's value. Predicates must be static methods. When the predicate returns null, the field can be updated. If a string is returned, this prevents the field from updating. The predicate attribute takes a type and a name indicating which type holds the predicate method and what the name of the method is. You can also provide generics for specific overloads of a given method. The method itself must take a single argument which has the same type as the field this attribute is applied to and it must return a string (or null). You can also apply multiple predicates, but the first to fail will be the one which displays its error. NOTE: If you use a ConfigEntry<T>, Mod Menu will unwrap this type and use the inner T instead. [AttributeUsage(AttributeTargets.Property|AttributeTargets.Field, AllowMultiple = true)] public class PredicateAttribute : Attribute, _Attribute Inheritance object Attribute PredicateAttribute api/ModMenu.Config.html.summary: Namespace ModMenu.Config Classes CategoryAttribute An attribute which can be applied to classes and fields that indicates the category they should be displayed under. ExcludeAttribute An attribute which tells Mod Menu to exclude a field or property. FieldAttribute An attribute which allows you to customise how a field will be displayed. This also provides extra information which can be used for data validation. FieldAttributes can be applied to either "plain" types or BepInEx ConfigEntry types. A "plain" type is something like an int, float, double, etc. IncludeAllAttribute An attribute which tells Mod Menu to include all fields in a class (apart from excluded ones). ListenerAttribute An attribute which provides a way of knowing when Mod Menu has changed a field's value. Listeners must be static methods. For listener attributes applied to fields: They must take a single value, which must match the type of the field If you use a ConfigEntry<T>, Mod Menu will unwrap this type and use the inner T instead. For listener attributes applied to classes: They must take two values, which are a MemberInfo and an object (in this order). The first argument is the MemberInfo of the field/property which was updated The second argument is the value it was set to PredicateAttribute An attribute which allows you to check a user input before Mod Menu updates a field's value. Predicates must be static methods. When the predicate returns null, the field can be updated. If a string is returned, this prevents the field from updating. The predicate attribute takes a type and a name indicating which type holds the predicate method and what the name of the method is. You can also provide generics for specific overloads of a given method. The method itself must take a single argument which has the same type as the field this attribute is applied to and it must return a string (or null). You can also apply multiple predicates, but the first to fail will be the one which displays its error. NOTE: If you use a ConfigEntry<T>, Mod Menu will unwrap this type and use the inner T instead. api/ModMenu.ModInfo.html.title: Class ModInfo | poy-mod-menu
api/ModMenu.ModInfo.html.summary: Class ModInfo Namespace ModMenu Assembly ModMenu.dll A class containing information about a mod, along with its registered configs. ModInfo instances are returned by Register(BaseUnityPlugin). When you Add a config to a ModInfo instance, it will be parsed and displayed within your mod's config page once ModView has built it. public class ModInfo Inheritance object ModInfo Inherited Members object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Fields description A description for this mod. By default this will be the description set in the AssemblyDescriptionAttribute of the Assembly of your mod. public string description Field Value string license This mod's license. public string license Field Value string theme The Theme to apply to this mod's config page. public Theme theme Field Value Theme thumbnail A texture to apply for the mod's thumbnail. If thumbnailUrl is set, the texture set here will still be used anyway. The URL will be ignored. public Texture2D thumbnail Field Value Texture2D thumbnailUrl A URL to download the mod's thumbnail from. If thumbnail is set, it will be used instead of this. public string thumbnailUrl Field Value string Properties name The name of this mod. (read only) This is the name set in the BepInPlugin attribute of your mod. public string name { get; } Property Value string onBuild Invokes listeners with a ModView when this mod's config page is being built. This allows you to apply some extra customisations before the page is fully created. public BuildEvent onBuild { get; } Property Value BuildEvent version This mod's version. (read only) This is the version set in the BepInPlugin attribute of your mod. public Version version { get; } Property Value Version Methods Add(ConfigFile) Adds a ConfigFile as a config. This allows you to add an entire BepInEx ConfigFile at once. Note: you miss out on customisation, but this could help for simplicity. public void Add(ConfigFile configFile) Parameters configFile ConfigFile The ConfigFile to add Add(object) Adds a given object as a config. This should be used for configs which have an instance (non static). public void Add(object obj) Parameters obj object The object to add Add(Type) Adds a given Type as a config. This should be used for static configs. public void Add(Type type) Parameters type Type The type to add

api/ModMenu.ModView.html.summary: Class ModView Namespace ModMenu Assembly ModMenu.dll Handles building and displaying a mod's config page. api/ModMenu.html.title: Namespace ModMenu | poy-mod-menu
api/ModMenu.html.summary: Namespace ModMenu Classes ModInfo A class containing information about a mod, along with its registered configs. ModInfo instances are returned by Register(BaseUnityPlugin). When you Add a config to a ModInfo instance, it will be parsed and displayed within your mod's config page once ModView has built it. ModManager The class which is used for registering mods to Mod Menu. ModView Handles building and displaying a mod's config page. It's worth checking out View for the extra functionality this class provides.

index.html.title: Mod Menu | poy-mod-menu
index.html.summary: Mod Menu A mod menu for Peaks of Yore made with UILib. Here are some useful links to get started: API Reference Examples Source Code
